intro: Onoctonia, commonly known as the nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants in the Solanaceae family. These plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers and typically have alternate, simple leaves. Many species within the genus contain alkaloids, which can be toxic or have medicinal properties. Onoctonia species are often found in a variety of habitats, including woodland edges and disturbed soils. They play an important role in both ecological and agricultural systems.
